intro: Macrocarpium chinense f. jinyangense, commonly known as the Yinyang mountain hibiscus, is a rare and unique variant of the species native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, featuring large, showy flowers with a striking bicolor pattern resembling the yinyang symbol. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant colors and unusual structure. It thrives in specific microhabitats, typically in shaded, humid environments within mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
